item.title: Database anomalies and isolation levels
item.description: Anomalies An anomaly or read phenomena can happen when a transaction reads data that may have been modified by another concurrent transaction. Dirty read A dirty read happens when a transaction T1 reads data that has been modified by a concurrent transaction T2 that has not has been committed or rolled back yet. T1 ends up working with stale data if T2 does not commit. T2 starts executing and sets x to a new value, T1 starts executing and reads x, the value of x is the value just set by T2, T2 rolls back, the value of x is not persisted to the database but T1 will move forward with the stale value of x that was written before T2 rolled back.
